request.content:
You are a module within an automated web agent tasked with simulating a user's interaction with a web page. Your specific role is the PERCEIVE module.

You will be provided with an environment that includes:
- A URL
- Simplified HTML content of THE CURRENT VIEWPOINT OF THE PAGE
- A list of all buttons on the page
- A list of all inputs on the page
- Optionally, a CSS selector called diff_selector of the element changed in the last step

Your task is to simulate human perception of the page accurately. Read the given viewpoint of the page from top to bottom and list all observations, capturing all the information that a human user would notice.
You should think in the first person.
The list of all buttons and all inputs are for reference only. You should only produce buttons within the viewpoint (the "page" you are looking at).
Do not describe relative order between observations, for example, "first" and "second" should not be used. Just describe them in the order they appear, but dont use "first" and "second" to describe them.
Since you will be only looking at a specific part of the page, which may be empty, you should only write what you see. If it's empty, just output an empty array.

If a diff_selector is provided, it means that the page only changed in the area of the element with the given selector.
In this case, the HTML shown to you is the changed part of the page.

## Principles
* **EACH OBSERVATION SHOULD BE INDEPENDENT**. For every logical element (not necessarily a single HTML element. A form, a product card, ...) should be described in ONE paragraph of observation.
    * For example, for `product-item-info` class, you should describe the product card as a whole. Do not split it into multiple observations.
    * User should be able to understand each observation independently. For example, "An 'Add to Cart' button is present on the product card, allowing users to easily add the Cheongeun Sweet Potato Starch Powder to their shopping cart." is not acceptable since the product name and other information are not included. Combine them into one observation.
* **WRITE EVERY DETAIL**. A blind person should able to understand every detail of the web page with your support. This including listing ALL OPTIONS of radio buttons, no matter how long are they.

Examples of observations include:
1. A search box with the input name "search" and placeholder "Search".
2. A button with the name "search" and the text "Search".
3. A list of products.
4. A product with the name XXX and ASIN XXX, priced at XXX.
5. A select option menu with sorting options 'price', 'name' and 'relevance'. The current selected option is 'price'.
6. A button named 'set ascending direction', which means the current sorting direction is descending.
7. There is a product card displayed for 'Belle Of The Ball Princess Sprinkle Mix'. It features an image of the product showcasing colorful sprinkles, and the image is accessible via a URL. The rating is shown as 'Rating: 63%', and there is a link to view '12 Reviews'. The product name is fully detailed and includes keywords related to its use, such as 'Wedding Colorful Sprinkles, Cake Cupcake Cookie Sprinkles, Ice Cream Candy Sprinkles, Yellow Gold Red Royal Red Rose Icing Flowers Decorating Sprinkles'. The price of the product is listed as '$23.50'. There is also an 'Add to Cart' button available for users to purchase this item.

Output your observations as a JSON object in the following format:

```json
{
    "observations": [
        "<observation 1>",
        "<observation 2>",
        ...
    ]
}
```

{"url": "http://ec2-3-131-244-37.us-east-2.compute.amazonaws.com:7770/crysully-men-s-jacket-fall-winter-thicken-windbreakers-bomber-jackets-padded-coats.html", "page": "CRYSULLY Men's Jacket-Fall Winter Thicken Windbreakers Bomber Jackets Padded Coats

CRYSULLY Men's Jacket-Fall Winter Thicken Windbreakers Bomber Jackets Padded Coats

Rating: 75 % of 100 12 Reviews
$41.99
", "clickables": ["header.search_box.search_button", "view_reviews", "product_form.options.army_green", "product_form.options.black", "product_form.options.blue", "product_form.options.dark_grey", "product_form.options.khaki", "product_form.options.navy_blue", "product_form.options.wine_red", "product_form.options.large", "product_form.options.medium", "product_form.options.small", "product_form.options.xlarge", "product_form.options.xxlarge", "product_form.add_to_cart", "product_info._details_", "product_info._reviews_12_", "product_info.reviews.pager._page_2_", "product_info.reviews.pager._page_next_"], "inputs": ["header.search_box.search_input", "product_form.quantity"], "diff_selector": ""}

{"url": "http://ec2-3-131-244-37.us-east-2.compute.amazonaws.com:7770/crysully-men-s-jacket-fall-winter-thicken-windbreakers-bomber-jackets-padded-coats.html", "page": "
Details
Reviews 12
Customer Reviews
  1. confirm size prior to ordering
    Rating: 80%
    Item came as expected... size slightly smaller than expected, but fits ok...suggest study of size chart prior to ordering...+ That it is washable...Would recommend... Review by LtColZ ret Posted on 4/18/23
  2. Arrived damaged
    Rating: 20%
    Jacket arrived with broken zipper and is not usable this jacket is defective product should be sold as seconds.Shame on seller shame on sellishame on cella. Review by danvion2 Posted on 4/18/23
  3. Good But Different
    Rating: 80%
    The jacket is pretty close to a proper fit. The main thing that was very different to me was the fly of the zipper was on the wrong side. It's not a big thing, but it will a little getting used to. Review by Eddie2010 Posted on 4/18/23
  4. Quality, Price & Availability for Christmas
    Rating: 100%
    Was delivered a little late, suppose to be a Christmas present my son did like the jacket, seemed like great quality, sizing was off a bit, but will order another one. Product was returned, and refunded in a timely manner by the merchant, and that is greatly appreciated! We will order a bigger size. Review by Cynthia Bollinger Posted on 4/18/23
  5. 2xl for 5,11 over 200 , jacket fits great
    Rating: 100%
    Great jacket for fall and early winter and looks sharp, I like it Review by David Posted on 4/18/23
  6. Warm but runs small
    Rating: 60%
    The first thing I disliked is the zipper is for left handed people.The size was smaller than sizing info stated.The insulation seems warm and the cuffs are not itchy. Review by FMC777 Posted on 4/18/23
  7. nice jacket
    Rating: 80%
    I like the jacket, although I would not have ordered it if I had realized it had a left-hand zipper, which to me is awkward. But that's my bad because you can plainly see it in the picture. Actually, it even mentions it in the description, which I also missed. Since a lot of these jackets are made in other parts of the world, I've noticed that many of them have left-hand zippers. Aside from the zipper, the jacket looks great and the fit is good. Review by Rick Eldridge Posted on 4/18/23
  8. A little thinner than expected but it still quite warm
    Rating: 80%
    I bought this for my boyfriend and he likes the look of it a lot but we thought it would be thicker/heavier but it was more on the light/thin side. It does keep him warmer than he expected tho. He's a man of few words and when I asked if he liked it so far (he's had it about two weeks now) he replied "yeah. It's straight." Believe it or not that's pretty much a 5 star review coming from him. I have to say he looks good in it. Actually so do I, truth be told. The jacket is not feminine in anyway but a female could definitely wear it. Review by Grace Posted on 4/18/23
  9. Warm this winter
    Rating: 80%
    I accidentally ordered the wrong color because the picture or the dark grey looked so close to the black, and was listed first, but that was my fault alone. I'm 5'8" 260lbs lery muscular chest and arms with a very large belly. The XXL I received is snug but comfortable with room to move. The arms are a little smaller than expected. If I had to order again, I would order the xxxl so I could fit some heavier layers under the coat. All in all , it's a nice coat that's made well and worth the money spent. Review by aaron h. Posted on 4/18/23
  10. Great fit, good quality for the price.
    Rating: 80%
    Great product for the price, after seeing some reviews I was skeptical but when I got mine it was perfect. A lot of people said you should order larger size Cos of the size difference between USA and China where it was manufactured, in 145 lbs and 5.9 ft. I usually wear a medium, but I first ordered an XL and it was too big, I returned it and reordered a medium and it fit as a glove. ???????? Great for spring and autumn or slightly cold weather. Review by KOSKOS Posted on 4/18/23

  • Page 2 Page 2
  • Page Next Page Next
